page.title: 12ORCADIAN NAMES
page.content: In Orkney some of the people have common Scottish{forenames}like John,James and Mary.More common than that are the Norwegian names that have been passed down from Viking men and woman like Thorfin,Magnus and Ingrid. In Orkney some{surnames}have been changed from true Norwegian like Haroldsson into Harrold and Amundason into Omond.Others surnames are called after places in Orkney like Firth,Rendall,Rousay,Mainland,Isbister and Sandwick. The main town in Orkney,Kirkwall was called Kyrkewa in 1274,Kirkwaw in 1422 and kirkwall in 1536. All of the{islands}are called after names which the Vikings called them.Sanday was called after Sandey which means 'sand _island'.
